stories.title: Shell to put profits from Russian oil trade into Ukraine aid fund

stories.text:
There are two clips making the round on social media of Putin in a circle with other people.

It is important to know the truth. This has implication on his reported germaphobic and absence in public.

I see 3 options:

- It is fake, he wasn't in the room with others.

- It is real, he isn't nearly as germaphobic as the press made him out to be.

- He dressed up his personal staff that has always been inside his bubble.

As i write this, social media has people tripping over each other to discuss option 1. There are currently 2 clips commonly shared.

A low quality Russian clip, showing his hand phase through a microphone https://twitter.com/alexkhrebet/status/1500170161726369799

A high quality clip used in foreign media. The independent appears to be using the longest cut. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BdqH2IeAYSU

Social media is busy arguing if this could be a compression artifacts or not. Others are saying its all composition shots. i.e. neither is addressing the others argument. Many subreddits have chosen to ban discussions entirely.

I'd like to know the truth, and Reddit or Twitter isn't the place to find out at the moment. Is anybody able to answer these two questions and elaborate on their process?

- Is the low resolution clip possible through compression artifacts?

- Is Putin really in the room with these people?

Cunningham tells me it is fake, the microphone in the high quality version doesn't react enough to the hand motion around it. Between 0:22 and 0:25 ( on highest quality ) the digital video should have the edges reacting. instead it looks like the microphone is painted on.
